summary: Email chain from August 13-15, 2019, arranging a visit by US Attorney's Office personnel to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York to inspect the facility, including the area where Jeffrey Epstein was held. The visit was to include viewing the psych observation/suicide watch area, the SHU, and Epstein's cordoned-off cell.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.context: US Attorney for the Southern District of New York; leading the office requesting the visit to the MCC to inspect areas including Epstein's cell.

persons.name: Ed O'Callahan
persons.context: Principal Deputy Attorney General; listed as an additional visitor from the DOJ joining the MCC tour.

connections.description: Both are high-ranking Department of Justice officials coordinating a visit to the MCC.

events.title: MCC Visit Arrangement
events.description: Final coordination for a visit by US Attorney's Office and DOJ personnel to the Metropolitan Correctional Center to tour specific areas, including the psych observation/suicide watch area, the SHU, and Jeffrey Epstein's cordoned-off cell.

locations: New York Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York planned a visit to the MCC shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The specific request was to see the psych observation/suicide watch area, the 9th floor SHU, and Epstein's cell, which was noted as still being cordoned off.
The visitors requested that only MCC legal staff escort them and that they would not speak to any guards present due to ongoing investigations.
The email chain shows coordination between the US Attorney's Office (Geoffrey Berman) and the MCC's legal counsel, involving additional DOJ personnel like Ed O'Callahan.
